drupalNodeEvent.title: Radio Audiobooks in Reform Era China

field_description.processed: It is well-known that in the 1980s literary journals served as main venues for the emergence of new authors. Other media, however, continued to contribute to the popularization of literature beyond the written page. This lecture will look at how the radio helped expand the audience of fiction, with a focus on the broadcasting of Lu Yaoâ€™s novel Ordinary World.
